intro: Astragalus gardanikaphtharicus, commonly known as the Persian milkvetch, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, including parts of Iran and Afghanistan. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky slopes and in dry grasslands. Astragalus gardanikaphtharicus is known for its ability to fix nitrogen in the soil, contributing to soil fertility in its native habitat.
